Description: A group of states sued several leading book publishers and Apple Inc. alleging they conspired to fix the price of electronic books. The publishers agreed to pay a total of $166 million (plus legal fees and costs) while Apple ended up paying $450 million. HarperCollins's share was $22.5 million.
Private Litigation Case Title: The State of Texas et al v. Hachette Book Group, Inc. et al
